lines.text: [first lines]
Keep the horse straight, Pa!
That's paying attention, Son.
Jensie? Jensie. You been talking in your sleep.
I was dreamin'.
You dream about your home. Is alright, Jensie. You miss your family. I know this. Is why is time to go back. Si, Jensie, si. Is time to go home.
Do ya mean it, Toral?
Si.

Oh, Toral! You do mean it, don't ya? Oh, I've been hopin', I've been hopin' so for so long. My home, my Mama. You'll meet my folks, and they'll understand, they will! I'll make 'em understand! I've been thinking 'bout it so long, and so hard, and I've decided I ain't gonna lie to 'em. I can't, Toral. I just gotta tell 'em the truth. When they see how much I love ya, and they see how good ya are, nothing bad that's happened'll matter. It'll be fine, Toral. It will, I know it will!
[last lines]
You go home now, Jensie. Is where you belong. I have new life now. You give this to me. We always be together. Tu eres mi vida. You are in my heart forever. Keep me in your heart. Adios, Jensie.

Pedro, I think I can make it. I think I'm strong enough, Pedro. I know we left it, but maybe we got back to it, and it is my river. We'll follow it home, and I'll take care of you. And you'll stay with me, and Dee'll love you. And there's lots of other animals you can be friends with. Oh, Pedro! And you and me'll be friends forever! Take me home, Pedro! Take me home!
My only friend. Nunca tuve otros amigos. Never. No-one. No have padre. No madre. No hermano. Only Pedro.
No madre? No mama?
No, nothing. Nada. Nothing mine. Solo mis tesouros. Only my treasure.
They ain't yours, Toral. You stole 'em. That ain't right. It hurts people.

[angrily]
Why no good people? People hurt me! You hurt me!
[Jensie takes a bottle of wine from the table]
Give me the bottle.
No.

[grabs shovel]
Give me the bottle!
[hits table with shovel]
Stop it!
Give me the bottle! Give me the bottle! Give me the bottle!
Stop it. Please stop it now. Por favor?

[smashes shelf with shovel]
Gimme!

[lets Toral take bottle]
Please don't drink no more. It ain't good for you.
Por que...
No more asking that. It don't matter none. Maybe if you sleep.
[Toral rests his head in Jensie's lap]
Why do you call me that? "Nina"?
Is you. Nina. Little girl.
I ain't no little girl!
Yes.
No, I ain't!
Si!
I have a real name, ya know.
Ah, si. Huh, I no ask you.
Anyway, it's Jensie.
Yensie... It's hard to say. Yensie...
No, J, J, Jensie.
Jensie...
Si, that's it!
Is pretty. Pretty name. Jensie... Jensie... little Jensie.
Tell me more, Toral.
I never talk like this about my life to nobody.
Tu eres mi coracao. Tu eres mi tesouro.
No. Tesouro, no. No. Tu... eres... mi vida. You are my life.
Si? "Mi vida." Tu eres mi vida.
[hugs Toral]
Oh Toral, there's so much good in you. You ain't bad, Toral. All you ever needed was somebody to be lovin' with.

As long as I can remember we've been living there. Came back east when I was about two. And it's been real hard, been a lot of work to do, but I guess it's the same for most folks. And momma lost two babies, and Pa and me had to do everything ourselves for a long time. Then Momma had Dee. Everyone sure was happy 'bout that! And the town's about ten miles away. We go to church every Sunday, but Momma's been schoolin' us at home cos the town's so far, which Dee don't mind none! Ain't this beautiful, Toral?

Why you no talk me? Always take women. Women afraid of me. All things afraid of me. I, Toral. Juan, Sebastian, Manuel, Enrique, Antonio, Jose Toral. My name. No Pedro. Pedro no afraid of me. Pedro mi amigo. No, no hurt Pedro. No hurt you, Pedro.
